body: You said you met this exception when you try to annotate text. Does this mean you get this error after you click the 'Annotate data' button? Did you upload data set successfully?
django 2.x confilt with sqlite 3.26.0，degrade sqlite to 3.25.3. django will fix it in next release.

> django 2.x confilt with sqlite 3.26.0，degrade sqlite to 3.25.3. django will fix it in next release.

After Downgrading it started working.Thanks for your quick response

Just for someone who sees this issue later.
I can not reimplement this error with Django 2.1.2 and SQLite 3.26.0. 

As @windranger747 said, the new Django 2.1.4 version should solve this problem. So besides downgrading SQLite, you can also try to upgrade the Django to 2.1.4.

* [SQLite 3.26 breaks database migration ForeignKey constraint, leaving <table_name>__old in db schema](https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/29182#comment:17)
* [Django 2.1.4 Fixed #29182](https://github.com/django/django/commit/c8ffdbe514b55ff5c9a2b8cb8bbdf2d3978c188f)

If this works, please give me feedback. I will update the Django version in requirements.txt

According to the feedback, updating Django does not work but downgrading SQLite works.

issue.title: Cannot delete labels and annoate entities

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### System information
- Linux Ubuntu 16.04
- Python version: 3.6

### Describe the problem
Bug report.
I follow the tutorial and try to annotate few simple entities such as Location, Person, etc.
I upload the sample data(text format, each line is a sentence without line break).
Two bugs are both related to django database (sqlite3 in my case) issue.
1) I cannot delete the labels I created in Label editor section.
2) I cannot annotate entity in Annotate Data section.

I have spent few hours reading the source code and trying to debug the issue. However, I didn't find the solution. I printed out the some logs. The query indicates a insertion into table 'server_sequenceannotation', however, the error shows django.db.utils.OperationalError: no such table: main.server_label__old which doesnot exist in the sqlite3 tables. The 'using' parameter in the traceback error is 'default'. I suspect this might be the reason but I am not very sure.
Please help with any suggestion. Very much appreciate it!

issue.title: Migrate failed

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
If you open a GitHub issue, here is our policy:

1. It must be a bug, a feature request, or a significant problem with documentation (for small docs fixes please send a PR instead).
2. The form below must be filled out.

------------------------

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: windows 10
- **Python version**:  python 3.6

body: I am on sqlite 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1 with django version 2.2.1 installed with conda. I am still getting this exact same error

Boa tarde 
Eu estava com o mesmo erro porem o makemigrations não esta lendo as modificaçoes no arquivo models.py. Pra resolver adicionei um novo item na tabela e rodei os comandos novamente 
(python manage.py makemigrations && python manage.py migrate) resolveu e todas as tabelas foram criadas normalmente.
